abstract: Samuel P. Huntington’s “clash of civilizations” thesis became a fundamental premise of post-cold-war foreign policy theory.
snippet: Samuel P. Huntington’s “clash of civilizations” thesis became a fundamental premise of post-cold-war foreign policy theory.
lead_paragraph: Samuel P. Huntington, an influential political scientist and longtime Harvard University professor, died at the age of 81 on Wednesday, according to an obituary on Harvard’s Web site. Mr. Huntington’s most famous thesis – that world conflicts stem from the competing cultural identities of seven or eight “civilizations” – became a fundamental, if controversial, premise of post-Cold War foreign policy theory. His emphasis on ancient religious empires, as opposed to states or ethnicities, gained even more cachet after the Sept. 11 attacks.

headline.main: Samuel P. Huntington of Harvard Dies at 81

snippet: Gov. Mark Sanford relented Wednesday and agreed to apply for $146 million in federal funds, after weeks of refusing to do so.
lead_paragraph: COLUMBIA, S.C.  Just hours before the unemployment benefits fund was to run out in South Carolina, the state with the nation’s third-highest jobless rate, Gov. Mark Sanford relented Wednesday and agreed to apply for a $146 million federal loan to shore it up, after weeks of refusing to do so.

headline.main: South Carolina Governor Relents on Jobless Funds
headline.print_headline: Governor Relents on Loan to Continue South Carolina Jobless Benefits

abstract: Gov. Rod R. Blagojevich of Illinois sought to appoint someone who would accept his offer and whose standing could help him.
snippet: Gov. Rod R. Blagojevich of Illinois sought to appoint someone who would accept his offer and whose standing could help him.
lead_paragraph: CHICAGO  Since his arrest on corruption charges on Dec. 9, Gov. Rod R. Blagojevich of Illinois wavered several times on whether to appoint a new senator to fill the seat vacated by President-elect Barack Obama, people with knowledge of his thinking said Wednesday.

headline.main: Tough Calculus for Blagojevich on Senate Seat
headline.print_headline: Tough Calculus For Blagojevich On Senate Seat

byline.original: By Monica Davey and Rachel L. Swarns

abstract: Douglas W. Elmendorf, an economist with experience throughout the federal government, has been selected to fill the vacancy left at the top of the Congressional Budget Office.
snippet: Douglas W. Elmendorf, an economist with experience throughout the federal government, has been selected to fill the vacancy left at the top of the Congressional Budget Office.
lead_paragraph: Democratic leaders in Congress have selected Douglas W. Elmendorf, an economist with experience throughout the federal government, to fill the vacancy left at the top of the Congressional Budget Office after President-elect Barack Obama recently chose its director for his Cabinet.

headline.main: Democratic Leaders Pick Budget Director

abstract: Fifty years after Fidel Castro seized power, many in South Florida wonder how long the pain must continue.
snippet: Fifty years after Fidel Castro seized power, many in South Florida wonder how long the pain must continue.
lead_paragraph: HIALEAH, Fla.  Four months after they appeared in the waters between Havana and Miami, the four dead men remain nameless. At a morgue in the Florida Keys, they lie on stretchers stacked like bunk beds, their bodies chewed by sharks, their faces too putrified to be recognized.

headline.main: Grief Marks Anniversary of Triumph of Castro
headline.print_headline: Grief Marks Anniversary Of Triumph Of Castro

lead_paragraph: It’s the time of year for resolutions.

lead_paragraph: Selling Barack Obama memorabilia has been lucrative for everyone from souvenir dealers to newspaper publishers to the Franklin Mint.

abstract: The man who killed nine people at a Christmas Eve party near Los Angeles had also hoped to kill his mother and his former wife’s divorce lawyer and the lawyer’s family.
snippet: The man who killed nine people at a Christmas Eve party near Los Angeles had also hoped to kill his mother and his former wife’s divorce lawyer and the lawyer’s family.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  The man who killed nine people in a shooting and arson spree at a Christmas Eve party in nearby Covina had also hoped to take the life of his own mother there, then drive to the home of his former wife’s divorce lawyer and kill him and his family, police officials said Tuesday.

headline.main: Gunman-Arsonist Had Plans Even Deadlier
headline.print_headline: Gunman-Arsonist Killer of 9 Had Plans Even Deadlier

abstract: Worth watching: The lineup for Senate confirmation hearings of Obama’s nominees firms up even more, and begins within a week.
snippet: Worth watching: The lineup for Senate confirmation hearings of Obama’s nominees firms up even more, and begins within a week.
lead_paragraph: With Congress returning next week, the calendar for confirmation hearings on nominees to President-elect Barack Obama’s Cabinet is becoming more crowded by the day. If anything, the slate of hearings so far seems to be near the pace set for the Bush administration’s nominees.

headline.main: Cabinet Confirmation Hearings Start Next Week

abstract: In the motion filed in federal court on Wednesday, United States Attorney Patrick J. Fitzgerald asked for more time because “multiple witnesses” have come forward in recent weeks and investigators have to review “thousands of intercepted phone calls.”
snippet: In the motion filed in federal court on Wednesday, United States Attorney Patrick J. Fitzgerald asked for more time because “multiple witnesses” have come forward in recent weeks and investigators have to review “thousands of intercepted phone cal...
lead_paragraph: The United States attorney prosecuting Gov. Rod R. Blagojevich of Illinois on federal corruption charges asked Wednesday for a 90-day extension to bring an indictment against the governor, as more details emerged about how Mr. Blagojevich worked behind closed doors to find someone to fill President-elect Barack Obama’s former Senate seat.

headline.main: Fitzgerald Asks for More Time on Blagojevich Indictment

byline.original: By Sharon Otterman and Monica Davey

abstract: There is uncertainty about whether Congressional leaders have the authority to refuse to seat Gov. Rod R. Blagojevich’s pick to fill the Senate seat vacated by Barack Obama.
snippet: There is uncertainty about whether Congressional leaders have the authority to refuse to seat Gov. Rod R. Blagojevich’s pick to fill the Senate seat vacated by Barack Obama.
lead_paragraph: Although Illinois Gov. Rod R. Blagojevich rolled out his appointee, Roland W. Burris, to fill the United States Senate seat vacated by President-elect Barack Obama, the governor’s reference to Mr. Burris as the “next United States senator from Illinois” might have been premature.

headline.main: The Early Word: What’s Next in Illinois?
